All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
ButtonForMap
represents a tile in the GUI and allows the user to interact with the tiles
CenterGridMenu
Defines the layout for the center component of the main menu using GridLayout.
Credits
Shows the previous highscores of this game.
Farm
the town collects one food from the tile with this structure
Forest
forests can be traversed and provide one wood
HighscoreCenter
manages the loading and saving of highscores
HighscoreReader
reads the highscores from the .txt file
Highscores
Shows the previous highscores of this game.
HighscoreWriter
writes the new Score into the highscore table file and saves it currently not used
IslandMaker
this class makes terrain grids as a basis for map creation the first dimension represents the rows the second dimension represents the columns meaning: Tile[y][x]
IslandView
this JPanel contains many JButtons which constitute the visual representation of the island
IslandViewContainer
Adds the main map area, which includes the UI for the game itself and surrounding buttons and displays.
LogicCenter
provides references to the logic objects which handle the game progress
LowerPanel
the panel in the lower half of the map view, containing instructions
Lumbermill
 
Main
the main entry point for the program execute this to play the game also used for testing
MainMenu
Defines the layout for the main menu using GridLayout.
MainWindow
Provides the enclosing structure for the main menu, map and other components.
Mountain
Mountain tiles can currently be traversed to allow for worker placement of outposts/mines provides gold/stone when worked
Ocean
Oceans are at the border of the map and limit the game are, providing one food
Outpost
extends the collection area to a specific tile currently used to represent a mine to mine gold from Mountain tiles to increase score
PieceMover
places and moves pieces across the island.
Plains
plains can be traversed and provide one food
PlayingPiece
this abstract class represents all pieces that can placed on the map including units and structures for example: towns, settlers.
RealEstateManager
knows where all the towns are and collects resources from them
ResourceCollector
collects resources from tiles
Ressources
TODO to be implemented in version 2
ScoreCounter
keeps track of the score attained throughout the game currently stone is treated as gold and used for scoring purposes this can be changed in future versions
Settler
a settler can found a town.
Storage
TODO update to enum Ressources in version 2 stores the collected ressources
Structure
structures are built by units: a settler can build a town a worker can build a house therefore structures do not have cost or speed values however they have a range in which they collect ressources structures have a X,Y coordinate on the grid corresponding to the map array
Tile
takes care of logic for tiles/the game object description: a forest is green, produces wood, and is accessible abstraction: a tile object has a terrain type a colour, a ressource, an accessible boolean a return method for ressource
Town
a town is a hub for resource collectio and unit training it is founded by a settler it collects resources from surrounding tiles image: Flaticon.com
TurnCounter
records which turn it is
TurnManager
manages the increase in turns and score when pressing the "next turn" button
Unit
object description: a settler is red, has a cost of 2 food, moves 1 tile per turn and can found a city abstraction: a unit type a unit object has a colour, a ressource cost, a speed value a method for founding a city units have a X,Y coordinate on the grid corresponding to the map array
UpperPanel
a panel for the upper side of a BorderLayout, containing various buttons and other components
Worker
